channel.title: British and American T.V.
channel.description: Hi. I am from Newcastle in the North East of England and whilst watching King Of Queens i wondered if any British shows make it onto American T.V and if you like the not. A lot of American shows make it onto our channels such as Family Guy, King of Queens, Laurel and Hardy... E.T.C. and i usually have a good laugh at them.

item.description:
Siggs:

oh gon, Blackadder the third is the best one, imho
.

But Blackadder goes forth has Baldrick’s awesome poetry.

The German Guns:

Boom, Boom, Boom, Boom,
Boom, Boom, Boom,
Boom, Boom, Boom, Boom,
Boom, Boom, Boom

Hear the words I sing:

Hear the words I sing,
War’s a horrid thing,
So I sing sing sing…
…ding-a-ling-a-ling.

item.description:
(rot)(fodder:

Keeping up appearences

Codgin:

Fawlty Towers

This. Or these :3

Fawlty Towers didn’t wither away like most American shows, it only made 12 episodes, each was pure gold.

Keeping Up Appearences is brilliant as well.

Also, Vicar of Dibley. I enjoy that.

item.title: British and American T.V.
item.dc:creator: Bolteh
item.description:
Siggs:

This is true, We’ve not delved into the shows of the past, faulty towers, monty pythons flying circus, some mothers do have’m, Father Ted, etc…

To be fair, Monty Python’s Flying Circus was pure shit after season 2. Season 3 had 1, maybe 2 good sketches. Season 4 was beyond tears. The first 2 seasons are brilliant, though.

Blackadder 2-3-4 are also brilliant (with 4 being amazing). I like Atkinson a lot better when he isn’t the Bean-ish type (like Bean and the first season of Blackadder).

Read full topic

item.title: British and American T.V.
item.dc:creator: Codgin
item.description:
y’all are missing the two best sitcoms/comedys ever made, and this is a fact, Dads Army and Fawlty Towers, the latter more so, if you want a lesson in writing genius comedic setup watch fawlty

but yeah i also agree each country has its own tastes, im pretty sure america wouldnt get the royale family (Not that one, the TV show). As for the Office what made the british version so great was it was so perfectly done as a fly on the wall some people actually thought it was a documentary, and ricky gervais’s occasional outrageous racist or sexist jokes followed by the long strecthed out awakardness of the situation was comedy perfection and excution, i think the usa office failed to hit this mark (This of course being personal oppionon). And as the simpsons, family guy, comments prove, we in england know when to end a show, and thats when the story dictates it to be, at its peak and with a bang, not when the viewing figures drop drasticly

Read full topic

item.title: British and American T.V.
item.dc:creator: Lord_Grievous
item.description:
I haven’t watched any new Simpsons episodes for years, but I think it’s going the same way with Family Guy. It used to be funny and it also had a story in it, nowadays it’s just so in your face. The early seasons hinted at Stewie being gay and Meg being unpopular, but now every episode has Stewie cross dressing and Meg being beaten up by everyone in Quahog :meh:

At least American Dad hasn’t succumbed to this yet.

Read full topic

item.title: British and American T.V.
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
I always hate new eps of the Simpsons, because I think back to the Bleeding Gums episode, the episode where Bart steals the game and so many other classics. Then I look at what it is today and it makes me sad. The end of Season 9 was the end of the Golden Era of Simpsons.

Read full topic
